title: You should use Orca Slicer instead of UltiMaker Cura for 3D printing
description: See what benefits Orca Slicer can offer over UltiMaker Cura.
author: Jeff Butts
excerpt: There are several choices for slicing software for 3D printing, but Orca Slicer offers several benefits UltiMaker Cura doesn't.
text: Hey there, 3D printing enthusiasts! If you’re in the market for a slicer, you’ve probably heard of UltiMaker Cura and Orca Slicer. Cura is the big name, but Orca Slicer has been gaining popularity lately. Its remarkable features make it an excellent choice for advanced users and anyone who wants to take their 3D printing to the next level. Let’s dive into why the Orca Slicer might be the perfect slicer for you. Whether you’re a beginner or a pro, Orca Slicer has got you covered. It has several unique features that can improve your 3D printing experience. Related Control and monitor your 3D printer from your Raspberry Pi using OctoPrint If you want a way to control and monitor your 3D printer, you should consider turning your Raspberry Pi into an OctoPrint server. 9 More advanced customization for power users Deeper control over printer and filament settings Orca Slicer is an excellent choice for users who want to customize their printer and filament settings in great detail. Unlike Cura, which can be a bit overwhelming with its general-purpose settings, Orca Slicer has streamlined its advanced options for users who want precision without getting bogged down. This makes it easier to focus on the essential details and get the best results. One of the cool things about Orca Slicer is that you can customize the start and end G-code scripts for the material used. Cura allows customizing these scripts for the printer itself, but adding the ability for filaments helps you control how your printer behaves in even more ways. You can also adjust the settings for each layer, which means you can control the print quality in super fine detail. This is especially useful if you’re working on complex projects or want to ensure your printer works at its best. Orca Slicer has detailed settings for the filament, including temperature, cooling, and extrusion. This means you can customize the settings for different filament types and get the best results. Whether printing with PLA, TPU, or something more advanced, Orca Slicer has got you covered. 8 Lightweight software with a focused design Streamlined interface tailored for efficiency OrcaSlicer is lightweight and includes a user interface that's easier to navigate than that of Cura Orca Slicer is a lightweight slicer that’s faster and more responsive than Cura, especially on less powerful computers. Its user interface is simple and easy to use, with only the most important tools. This makes slicing more effortless and less frustrating, especially when working on multiple projects. If you want a clean and efficient slicing experience, Orca Slicer is the way to go. It has a simple layout that makes it easy to find the tools you need, even if you’re not an expert. Whether you’re printing for yourself or your business, Orca Slicer will make slicing a breeze. Like Cura, Orca Slicer is available for Windows, macOS, and Linux. Rapid development for evolving user needs Orca Slicer is known for its active development and regular updates. The developers keep in touch with the community, so the software keeps up with what people need and what they say. This collaboration makes significant improvements that will really benefit users and align with the latest technology and methods. The frequent updates mean that bugs get fixed quickly, and new features are added to keep the slicer competitive. This responsive development cycle gives it a big advantage over Cura, which can take longer to update. With Orca Slicer, users can trust that the slicer will always be up-to-date with the latest 3D printing advancements, giving them cutting-edge functionality without delays. If you want software that’s always up-to-date with the latest printing advancements, Orca Slicer’s commitment to community-driven improvements is a great reason to switch. This dynamic approach ensures that users always have the tools and features they need to succeed. Plus, the regular communication between developers and users builds trust. 6 Better support generation for complex models Simplified support for intricate designs Orca Slicer is a top pick for creating support structures for complex models with overhangs. Its support algorithms are super-intelligent, ensuring that your prints stay stable during printing and are easy to remove afterward. This is especially useful for projects with tricky designs where support materials can cause problems. Unlike Cura, which often leaves behind tricky-to-remove supports or marks on your model, Orca Slicer ensures its supports are efficient and don’t leave any residue. This means your prints will look great and stay strong. Orca Slicer’s user-friendly interface makes it easy for both pros and hobbyists to control and optimize support placement. This means you can get the best results and save time on post-processing. Detailed previews for better planning A comparison of previewing slice file in OrcaSlicer (L) and Utilimaker Cure (R) Orca Slicer has some awesome visualization tools that let you see your prints layer by layer. This way, you can precisely see how the slicer interprets your model. You can spot problems like weak supports or gaps in the print before you start. Orca Slicer also provides all the information you need about the printing time, material, and cost. This is especially helpful for people with multiple projects or who want to ensure a smooth production process. By making it easy to plan and minimize mistakes, Orca Slicer helps you get reliable results with less trial and error. And the best part? These visualization tools help you make smart decisions throughout the printing process. 4 Better for advanced hardware setups Optimized for custom and high-performance printers Orca Slicer is a game-changer when paired with advanced 3D printers like CoreXY machines or custom-built printers. Its default profiles and settings are specifically designed for these setups, making it a perfect fit for users with specialized hardware. These profiles are carefully crafted to maximize your printer’s capabilities, ensuring high-quality prints with minimal manual intervention. On the other hand, Cura’s general-purpose profiles often require extensive manual adjustments to work well with custom printers. Orca Slicer’s tailored options make the process much easier, allowing advanced setups to function at their best. This convenience is essential for users who want to get the most out of their printers and avoid the time-consuming trial-and-error of custom configurations. If you have a printer with high-speed capabilities or unique settings, Orca Slicer’s hardware support can take your print performance and quality to the next level. Whether you’re working on complex geometries, aiming for flawless surfaces, or dealing with projects that require precise tolerances, Orca Slicer is up for the challenge. 3 Integrated support for input shaping Enhanced print quality through vibration control Orca Slicer works alongside Klipper, OctoPrint, and other 3D printer programs. Thanks to these integrations, you can access input shaping calibration without leaving Orca Slicer. This tool helps reduce vibrations during high-speed printing, especially for Klipper users. This means better print quality without slowing things down. Input shaping ensures your printer works excellently even when printing is fast, making it more precise and durable. With input shaping, you can avoid ghosting and other print problems caused by vibrations. This is beneficial for printing detailed models where quality is crucial. Cura doesn’t have any form of built-in input shaping, so you have to use external apps or plugins. Orca Slicer has all of this built-in, so you don’t have to worry about it. It saves you time and makes printing faster and easier. That way, you can focus on the creative part of printing without getting bogged down by technical stuff. Easy and accurate tuning for optimal prints Orca Slicer has some cool features that make it easy to calibrate your printer. It has built-in tools for adjusting the flow rate and pressure, which is essential for getting consistent and precise prints. You don’t need any special software or a lot of trial and error to make these adjustments. This makes it easy for beginners and experienced users alike to get the best results. Pressure Advance calibration allows you to start and stop printing exactly when you want, avoiding problems like blobs and stringing. Flow Rate calibration keeps the print consistent, preventing over- or under-extrusion. These tools make it easy to print high-quality prints, even on complex and large-scale projects. If you want to get the most out of your calibration, Orca Slicer’s features are better than Cura’s. You can easily get the best results with minimal effort and experiment with different filaments and techniques. This makes it an excellent choice for anyone who wants to print professional-grade prints. 1 Optimized for Klipper and Voron users Unleashing the potential of high-end setups Source: Unsplash Orca Slicer is designed for advanced setups, especially those using OctoPrint, Klipper firmware, or Voron printers. These setups benefit from Orca Slicer’s noteworthy features, like input shaping and advanced G-code options. It is perfect for users who want to improve their printer’s performance and achieve great results with little effort. For Voron users, Orca Slicer’s profiles and settings work great with the printer, making it run as fast and well as possible. Klipper users also like how Orca Slicer can make G-code that uses the printer’s advanced features for better printing. This combination is the best way to do things. Cura can be used with these setups too, but often requires extra plugins or extensive manual changes. Orca Slicer is already programmed to work with these setups, so it’s the best choice for users with high-performance printers. This allows users to focus more on making things rather than fixing problems, which is especially important in busy environments. Choosing the slicer that’s right for you UltiMaker Cura and Orca Slicer are both great slicing software, but Orca Slicer has some unique features that make it a better choice for most people. Whether you’re a custom printer owner, a speed demon, or someone who needs software that grows with you, Orca Slicer has got you covered. It’s got all the power and flexibility you need to take your 3D printing to the next level. And the best part? It’s made by people who actually use it, so you know it’ll work for you. Whether you’re a hobbyist or a pro, Orca Slicer is the slicing software for you. Your changes have been saved Orca Slicer Your changes have been saved UltiMaker Cura
html:
Hey there, 3D printing enthusiasts! If you’re in the market for a slicer, you’ve probably heard of UltiMaker Cura and Orca Slicer. Cura is the big name, but Orca Slicer has been gaining popularity lately. Its remarkable features make it an excellent choice for advanced users and anyone who wants to take their 3D printing to the next level.

Let’s dive into why the Orca Slicer might be the perfect slicer for you. Whether you’re a beginner or a pro, Orca Slicer has got you covered. It has several unique features that can improve your 3D printing experience.

Related

Control and monitor your 3D printer from your Raspberry Pi using OctoPrint

If you want a way to control and monitor your 3D printer, you should consider turning your Raspberry Pi into an OctoPrint server.

9 More advanced customization for power users

Deeper control over printer and filament settings

Orca Slicer is an excellent choice for users who want to customize their printer and filament settings in great detail. Unlike Cura, which can be a bit overwhelming with its general-purpose settings, Orca Slicer has streamlined its advanced options for users who want precision without getting bogged down. This makes it easier to focus on the essential details and get the best results.

One of the cool things about Orca Slicer is that you can customize the start and end G-code scripts for the material used. Cura allows customizing these scripts for the printer itself, but adding the ability for filaments helps you control how your printer behaves in even more ways. You can also adjust the settings for each layer, which means you can control the print quality in super fine detail. This is especially useful if you’re working on complex projects or want to ensure your printer works at its best.

Orca Slicer has detailed settings for the filament, including temperature, cooling, and extrusion. This means you can customize the settings for different filament types and get the best results. Whether printing with PLA, TPU, or something more advanced, Orca Slicer has got you covered.

8 Lightweight software with a focused design

Streamlined interface tailored for efficiency

OrcaSlicer is lightweight and includes a user interface that's easier to navigate than that of Cura

Orca Slicer is a lightweight slicer that’s faster and more responsive than Cura, especially on less powerful computers. Its user interface is simple and easy to use, with only the most important tools. This makes slicing more effortless and less frustrating, especially when working on multiple projects.

If you want a clean and efficient slicing experience, Orca Slicer is the way to go. It has a simple layout that makes it easy to find the tools you need, even if you’re not an expert. Whether you’re printing for yourself or your business, Orca Slicer will make slicing a breeze. Like Cura, Orca Slicer is available for Windows, macOS, and Linux.

Rapid development for evolving user needs

Orca Slicer is known for its active development and regular updates. The developers keep in touch with the community, so the software keeps up with what people need and what they say. This collaboration makes significant improvements that will really benefit users and align with the latest technology and methods.

The frequent updates mean that bugs get fixed quickly, and new features are added to keep the slicer competitive. This responsive development cycle gives it a big advantage over Cura, which can take longer to update. With Orca Slicer, users can trust that the slicer will always be up-to-date with the latest 3D printing advancements, giving them cutting-edge functionality without delays.

If you want software that’s always up-to-date with the latest printing advancements, Orca Slicer’s commitment to community-driven improvements is a great reason to switch. This dynamic approach ensures that users always have the tools and features they need to succeed. Plus, the regular communication between developers and users builds trust.

6 Better support generation for complex models

Simplified support for intricate designs

Orca Slicer is a top pick for creating support structures for complex models with overhangs. Its support algorithms are super-intelligent, ensuring that your prints stay stable during printing and are easy to remove afterward. This is especially useful for projects with tricky designs where support materials can cause problems.

Unlike Cura, which often leaves behind tricky-to-remove supports or marks on your model, Orca Slicer ensures its supports are efficient and don’t leave any residue. This means your prints will look great and stay strong.

Orca Slicer’s user-friendly interface makes it easy for both pros and hobbyists to control and optimize support placement. This means you can get the best results and save time on post-processing.

Detailed previews for better planning

A comparison of previewing slice file in OrcaSlicer (L) and Utilimaker Cure (R)

Orca Slicer has some awesome visualization tools that let you see your prints layer by layer. This way, you can precisely see how the slicer interprets your model. You can spot problems like weak supports or gaps in the print before you start.

Orca Slicer also provides all the information you need about the printing time, material, and cost. This is especially helpful for people with multiple projects or who want to ensure a smooth production process.

By making it easy to plan and minimize mistakes, Orca Slicer helps you get reliable results with less trial and error. And the best part? These visualization tools help you make smart decisions throughout the printing process.

4 Better for advanced hardware setups

Optimized for custom and high-performance printers

Orca Slicer is a game-changer when paired with advanced 3D printers like CoreXY machines or custom-built printers. Its default profiles and settings are specifically designed for these setups, making it a perfect fit for users with specialized hardware. These profiles are carefully crafted to maximize your printer’s capabilities, ensuring high-quality prints with minimal manual intervention.

On the other hand, Cura’s general-purpose profiles often require extensive manual adjustments to work well with custom printers. Orca Slicer’s tailored options make the process much easier, allowing advanced setups to function at their best. This convenience is essential for users who want to get the most out of their printers and avoid the time-consuming trial-and-error of custom configurations.

If you have a printer with high-speed capabilities or unique settings, Orca Slicer’s hardware support can take your print performance and quality to the next level. Whether you’re working on complex geometries, aiming for flawless surfaces, or dealing with projects that require precise tolerances, Orca Slicer is up for the challenge.

3 Integrated support for input shaping

Enhanced print quality through vibration control

Orca Slicer works alongside Klipper, OctoPrint, and other 3D printer programs. Thanks to these integrations, you can access input shaping calibration without leaving Orca Slicer. This tool helps reduce vibrations during high-speed printing, especially for Klipper users. This means better print quality without slowing things down. Input shaping ensures your printer works excellently even when printing is fast, making it more precise and durable.

With input shaping, you can avoid ghosting and other print problems caused by vibrations. This is beneficial for printing detailed models where quality is crucial.

Cura doesn’t have any form of built-in input shaping, so you have to use external apps or plugins. Orca Slicer has all of this built-in, so you don’t have to worry about it. It saves you time and makes printing faster and easier. That way, you can focus on the creative part of printing without getting bogged down by technical stuff.

Easy and accurate tuning for optimal prints

Orca Slicer has some cool features that make it easy to calibrate your printer. It has built-in tools for adjusting the flow rate and pressure, which is essential for getting consistent and precise prints. You don’t need any special software or a lot of trial and error to make these adjustments. This makes it easy for beginners and experienced users alike to get the best results.

Pressure Advance calibration allows you to start and stop printing exactly when you want, avoiding problems like blobs and stringing. Flow Rate calibration keeps the print consistent, preventing over- or under-extrusion. These tools make it easy to print high-quality prints, even on complex and large-scale projects.

If you want to get the most out of your calibration, Orca Slicer’s features are better than Cura’s. You can easily get the best results with minimal effort and experiment with different filaments and techniques. This makes it an excellent choice for anyone who wants to print professional-grade prints.

1 Optimized for Klipper and Voron users

Unleashing the potential of high-end setups

Orca Slicer is designed for advanced setups, especially those using OctoPrint, Klipper firmware, or Voron printers. These setups benefit from Orca Slicer’s noteworthy features, like input shaping and advanced G-code options. It is perfect for users who want to improve their printer’s performance and achieve great results with little effort.

For Voron users, Orca Slicer’s profiles and settings work great with the printer, making it run as fast and well as possible. Klipper users also like how Orca Slicer can make G-code that uses the printer’s advanced features for better printing. This combination is the best way to do things.

Cura can be used with these setups too, but often requires extra plugins or extensive manual changes. Orca Slicer is already programmed to work with these setups, so it’s the best choice for users with high-performance printers. This allows users to focus more on making things rather than fixing problems, which is especially important in busy environments.

Choosing the slicer that’s right for you

UltiMaker Cura and Orca Slicer are both great slicing software, but Orca Slicer has some unique features that make it a better choice for most people. Whether you’re a custom printer owner, a speed demon, or someone who needs software that grows with you, Orca Slicer has got you covered. It’s got all the power and flexibility you need to take your 3D printing to the next level. And the best part? It’s made by people who actually use it, so you know it’ll work for you. Whether you’re a hobbyist or a pro, Orca Slicer is the slicing software for you.
